intro: Oreocharis wentsaii, commonly known as the Wentsaii bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis wentsaii is considered a vulnerable species.
